title: Ticket #5553: 1 minute startup block if DNS record missing
description:
When any HTCondor program starts, be it daemon or command line tool, it does a DNS lookup on our best guess for a hostname. It's trying to find a fully qualified domain name as well as an IP address. However, if the lookup fails for any reason we will retry every 3 seconds for up to 1 minute. The program blocks during this period. This is particularly noticeable on command line tools. The code always run as it provides configuration variables like IP_ADDRESS, which may be necessary to correctly interpret the configuration file.

The unwanted behavior appears in [37747] 8c1a0005e224738c5f1ee6beeacda17a7529cd1 as a fix for "#3956: some schedd ads have a blank Name attr, make malformed GlobalJobIds". The code in question has been completely rewritten, but the behavior was carefully preserved. It's in init_local_hostname_impl in /src/condor_utils/ipv6_hostname.cpp, around line 117. Look for "SLEEP_DUR = 3".

The original commit (88c1a) was trying intended to retry only for EAI_AGAIN. That is likely correct behavior. However, it will retry even for permanent errors (say, EAI_NONAME).

Proposed fix: immediately after this code: 

int ret = ipv6_getaddrinfo(test_hostname.Value(), NULL, ai, hint);
if(ret == 0) { gai_success = true; break; }

Add something like 

if(ret != EAI_AGAIN) {
	gai_success = false;
	dprintf(...) // Details about the error returned and note about failure.
	break;
}
